intro: Hussonia uncata, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a low, spreading growth habit with narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Hussonia uncata is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
